page.para: What Dalitso found
School was over for the day.
Dalitso was walking home, feeling bored.
He kicked at the stones.
Suddenly, he saw a piece of paper on the ground.
Eeek! It was money!
Dalitso looked around. There was nobody on the road.
Nobody was watching.
He put the money in his pocket.
He thought of all the things he could buy. A yummy snack? Trainers? A mobile phone? A bike? He smiled, and walked faster.
When he reached home, he showed Chifundo the money.
“Wow,” said Chifundo. “But you can’t keep it. It’s not yours. We must find the owner.”
The children walked back to where Dalitso had found the money. Now there were people everywhere. They were searching for something.
They saw Sara.
“Hello Sara. What are you looking for?” asked Chifundo.
“Mr Banda has lost his money,” said Sara. “He is very upset.”
The children went over to Mr Banda.
“Is this yours, Mr Banda?” asked Chifundo.
She held out the money.
Mr Banda snatched the money. “You stole it. You are wicked children.”
“No. I found it,” said Dalitso. Then the children turned and ran.
The next day, the children saw someone cycling up the road.
“Oh no! It is Mr. Banda,” said Dalitso. “I am in trouble.”
Mr Banda was smiling. “Thank you for giving me my money back,” he said. “You are good children. I have brought you a present.”
He handed a box to Chifundo. She opened it.
“Oh! A kite!” said the children. “Thank you, Mr Banda.”
Now everyone was smiling.
